title: 111_hr2746
content: Expansion of transit operating assistance grant program. Expansion of transit operating assistance grant program by amending Section 5307(b) of title 49, United States Code to include operating costs of equipment and facilities for use in public transportation in urbanized areas with a population of at least 200,000. The text discusses the operating costs of equipment and facilities for public transportation in urbanized areas based on population thresholds. The text discusses limitations on grants for public transportation in urbanized areas based on population thresholds. Grants under paragraph (1)(E) are limited to 50% of funds, while grants under paragraph (1)(F) are limited to 45% of funds available. The text discusses limitations on grants for public transportation in urbanized areas based on population thresholds. Grants under paragraph (1)(E) are limited to 50% of funds, while grants under paragraphs (1)(F), (G), (H), and (I) have decreasing fund availability limits of 45%, 40%, 35%, and 30% respectively. The Secretary may award grants for operating costs of equipment and facilities for public transportation in urbanized areas with a population of at least 200,000, from funds available for fiscal years 2010 through 2015. The grants are for designated recipients with a percentage of revenue from non-Federal sources. The Secretary may award grants for operating costs of equipment and facilities for public transportation in urbanized areas with a population of 200,000 or more, funded by non-Federal sources. Grants are available for fiscal years 2010 through 2015. The Secretary may award grants for operating costs of equipment and facilities for public transportation in urbanized areas with a population of 200,000 or more, if the recipient demonstrates a minimum 10 percent total energy savings or a minimum 10 percent energy savings as a percentage of the total energy usage of the public transit agency as a result of the project funded by the grant. The Secretary may award grants for operating costs of equipment and facilities for public transportation in urbanized areas with a population of 200,000 or more, if the recipient demonstrates a minimum 10 percent total energy savings or a minimum 10 percent energy savings as a percentage of the total energy usage of the public transit agency as a result of the project funded by the grant. Not less than 10 percent of the funds available for this section shall be made available for the grants.
